keyword: calories in one scoop ice cream
title: Calories in One Scoop of Ice Cream
meta_description: Discover calories in one scoop ice cream, including full nutrition breakdown like carbs, fat, protein, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in One Scoop of Ice Cream
assumptions: Vanilla ice cream, standard full-fat; one scoop â‰ˆ 1/2 cup or 66 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, flavor, fat content, and scoop size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One scoop of vanilla ice cream has about 137 kcal and 7.3 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add chocolate syrup (1 tbsp per scoop)

faqs.q: How many calories in one scoop ice cream?
faqs.a: Approximately 137 kcal for a standard vanilla scoop.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one scoop of ice cream?
faqs.a: About 15.5 g carbs, mostly from sugars (12.8 g).

faqs.q: Is ice cream high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, one scoop has 7.3 g total fat, including 4.5 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does flavor affect calories in ice cream?
faqs.a: Chocolate or premium flavors can add 20-50 kcal per scoop due to extra sugar and fat.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in one scoop ice cream?
faqs.a: Low at about 2.3 g per standard scoop.
